text: Inman is a city in McPherson County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 1,341 people lived there. == History == Inamn was created in 1887. It was called Aiken. Its name changed to Inman, in 1889. It was named after Major Henry Inman. He was the namesake for Lake Inman, located about east of the town. The history of the name "Inman" is that it is one of many versions of the biblical name "John". == Geography == Inman is at (38.232423, -97.772212). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ===Weather=== Inman has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Inman has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Inman, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 1,341 people, 528 households, and 329 families living in Inman. Of the households, 74.8% owned their home and 25.2% rented their home. The median age was 44.0 years. Of the people, 94.6% were White, 0.5% were Black, 0.2% were Native American, 0.2% were Asian, 0.8% were from some other race, and 3.6% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 1.1% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,377 people, 513 households, and 347 families living in Inman. ==Education== Inman is part of Inman USD 448 school district.USD 448Kansas School District Boundary Map ==References== ==More reading== * A Centennial History, Inman, Kansas, 1887-1987; Inman Heritage Association; 1987. * Hoffnungsau in Kansas ; A.J.
